divs: sighting detailsat 11:47 pm [tg], a straight light moved from one altocumulus cloud to another cloud near by, about a 1 mile high or 5 to 6,000 ft at 45 degrees from the horizon as a references point. it was a white and yellow string of solid light, moving in a straight line with impressive speed-not a lighting nor a shoooting star. it was not a shooting star, i have seen many of those, neither was a moondog(nor sundog- it happen at night), nor a halo nor anything analogous to atmospheric phenomena. it looked more like a firework, shooting high in the air, with the exception that i could see the beginning of it, and it was amazing, i was looking of the moon located at the southwest and talking in the phone to my best friend in nv, when i sudendly told him, you won`t believe what just happened here, the phone call ended abruptly w\o neither one of us hanging the phone, he redial me to made sure i was ok. i described to my friend to the best of my abilities. that thing began swerving [tg] without any light, like a wave of simmering steam emaning from a cloud, it was tranparent and then lit itself with a white and pale yellow light. and it stretch or extends from a point a to point b, like if someone was drawing it with a crayon made of light a thick line of light. it`s was surreal. it was quite late, so i can say that anyone else in the houston area saw it too, unless they had happened to be looking of the sky in the precise moment.
trends: There have been no other sightings in Rosenberg
This sighting has never been favorited.
